column1: Now you know what dummy text is
column2: let’s learn about its usefulness. Some people say that they don’t need to use a dummy text generator to deliver a web design project to the customer. Even though this might be true
column3: the effect that the final project will produce on the client won’t be as satisfactory as in the case of one with included filler content.

column1: A dummy text generator gives web designers the content they need. Then
column2: they can use the typefaces and layout they prefer
column3: thus obtaining the best mock-up of their work. It would be best to be impossible to understand and read because people might get distracted by the text itself and its nonsense rather than analyzing how the typefaces integrate into the design instead.

column1: Dummy text shouldn’t make any logical sense
column2: to keep people from focusing on it instead of the visual impact it has. Using filler text is all about facilitating the visual impression of a final piece of web design.
